title: Osho_The Last Testament vol 6 of 6
description:
Audio: MP3 49.0 Kbps, 32.0 KHz, 1 channel, 

The Last Testament, Vol 6
Interviews with the World Press
Talks given from 30/01/86 through different times of 1986, up to 1989.
not continuously..
English Discourse series
16 chapters but 5,11,are missing so there are just 14.

(Last public Osho talk was on 10th april 1989: The Zen Manifesto: Freedom From Oneself, # 11"Samasati". These were last words in public to sannyasins and to all.)

The last Osho talk in this vol 6 is last Osho's interview alltogether , given on 21 July 1989 am in LaoTzu House, Poona, India, 
After that there was just silence..no talk.
This last interview was 
Interview with Swami Satya Vedant asking questions from Pritish Nandy, Illustrated Weekly of India,
Osho: So, I should address to Shree Pritish, that will be better.
VEDANT: BELOVED OSHO,
IN VIEW OF THE UPCOMING GENERAL ELECTIONS, THE EDITOR OF ILLUSTRATED WEEKLY,
MR. PRITISH NANDY HAS REQUESTED YOUR VIEWS ON A VARIETY OF ISSUES CONFRONTING
INDIA TODAY.
THE FIRST QUESTION:
WHAT IN YOUR VIEW SHOULD BE INDIA'S EDUCATIONAL POLICY?
..........................
free book can be downloaded if you ask Google, or from oshoworld(dot)com

Many of the interviews from the World Tour have not been listed as being part of any Last Testament Volume and they have been arbitrarily assigned to Vol.'s 4, 5 and 6 in groups of thirty.

It is difficult to match audio discourses and transcriptions in printed book
Some of discourses in this volume were given in Kathmandu Nepal, some were given in Bombay; the last one in Poona.
Discourse no 4 listed in text is announced like Discourse no 34 Light on the Path. Therefore I placed this audio as no 4 in TLT vol 6.
(text from Light on the Path no 34 is not equivalent to this talk..I don't know where it should be and where is audio which belongs to it.
Different topics were spoken here as answers to the questions. 

try to watch him on video as much you can.He said that in this way (video) he can transfer much more then in any other way (books, audios)
